text:
I have a correct manifest.mf with :
Provide-Package: aaaaaaaaa,(newline)
(space)bbbbbbbb

And the following ant task :

<manifest file="MANIFEST.MF" mode="update">
   <attribute name="Bundle-Version" value="x.y.z"/>
</manifest>

The version is correctly updated, but the (newline) in provide-package is removed;
This is correct according to JAR documentation by SUN (1.4.2), but this seems to
be unsuported by Eclipse, and I think it is not correct to remove the newlines...
The correct behaviour for me is that only the Bundle-Version change, not the
rest of the manifest.mf !!!
creator: dutoitc@shimbawa.ch

text:
It sounds like this is a bug associated with Eclipse rather than Ant then.  As
you say, the Jar spec allows it to remove newlines, if Eclipse needs those
newlines to work then that suggests you should post a bug with the Eclipse
developers
creator: kevin.jackson@it.fts-vn.com

text:
I'm going to be ruthless and mark as invalid. 

We get a lot of bugreps related to manifests, and they are almost all invalid.
Think about it: ant creates most of the manifests on the planet; if we got it
wrong, nothing would work. This is why Ant parses and rewrites the manifest - it
does understand the rules and knows how to break lines, what the line endings
are, etc.

If there is a problem, take it up with the people downstream who havent read the
spec or had a stable implementation for as long as the ant team. 

If you want a quick workaround, dont use <manifest>, just create a text file
(<echo>?) and then use <zip> instead of <jar>.
creator: stevel@apache.org
